title: Tour operator apologises over Turkish "terrorist" entertainment
text:
Tour operator apologises over Turkish "terrorist" entertainment 13 August 2015 Save 
Jet2Holidays has apologised to its customers after a Turkish hotel’s entertainment left them fearing they were being targeted in a terrorist attack. 
Holidaymakers staying at the five-star Grand Yazici Mares resort, which is on sale via a number of UK operators including First Choice, Thomas Cook, lowcostholidays and Alpharooms, in Icmeler have told The Sun that they were relaxing by the pool last Thursday when a group of men wearing outfits and carrying pretend guns appeared. 
Holidaymaker Jason Phythian told the paper: “It was the hotel’s idea of entertainment for the day. 
“They thought it was funny to run around the pool dressed as terrorists.” 
The hotel was unable to comment when it was contacted by TTG. However, a spokeswoman for Jet2holidays said the company had apologised to the party that included Phythian and immediately spoke to the hotel about the incident. 
She added: “The hotel management have assured us it was never their intention to cause any offence or upset with their entertainment programme. 
“This was a Hollywood-themed poolside show, which included the characters Rambo and Superman, and it is always well received by the hotel’s residents. 
“The management now understands some of the costumes may have caused offence and will no longer use these in their shows.”
